# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * ' '
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the text into words and then builds an array of lines, adding a new line each time the current line would exceed the specified `text_width`. It also handles the case where the last line may not reach the `text_width` limit by pushing it to the array regardless. Finally, it joins the lines with a newline character to create a multi-line string.
